articles.title: 7 Things to Know About the God Bless America (YALL) ETF
articles.summary: The God Bless America ETF (YALL) is a new exchange-traded fund designed to invest in "anti-woke" companies that avoid "left-leaning statements" unrelated to their businesses. The ETF prioritizes valuation metrics like P/E ratios and job growth, with Tesla (TSLA) and Nvidia (NVDA) as its top holdings. It will have an expense ratio of 0.65% and hold 30-40 U.S.-listed companies with market capitalizations over $1 billion.

articles.title: Nvidia closes Russian offices, will fly relocating employees out of the country, report says
articles.summary: Nvidia is ceasing all activities and closing its offices in Russia, offering its employees the opportunity to relocate out of the country. The company had previously suspended shipments to Russia but maintained an office to support employees and their families. Nvidia stated that recent developments have made it impossible to operate effectively there.

articles.title: U.S. Speaker Pelosi's husband sold Nvidia, Micron options at a loss
articles.summary: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband, Paul Pelosi, sold call options in chipmakers Micron Technology and Nvidia, incurring losses close to $1 million. The transactions were disclosed in a transparency filing, which also showed he exercised call options for Alphabet shares and allowed Walt Disney call options to expire at a loss. This comes amid scrutiny over stock trading by lawmakers and their families, leading to legislative efforts to restrict such activities.

articles.title: Kroger, Albertsons spin-off is extra ammunition in regulatory battle
articles.summary: Kroger and Albertsons are proposing to divest up to 650 stores, potentially through a spin-off to Albertsons shareholders, to gain regulatory approval for their $24.6 billion merger. This unusual structure aims to expedite divestitures amidst regulatory scrutiny and challenges in finding buyers for unionized stores, especially after a previous failed divestiture involving Albertsons and Safeway. The FTC, under Chair Lina Khan, is expected to closely examine the proposal given her skepticism towards large mergers impacting consumers.

articles.title: Columbia Research Enhanced Core ETF (RECS) and Columbia Research Enhanced Value ETF (REVS) Celebrate Three-Year Milestone
articles.summary: Columbia Threadneedle Investments announced the three-year anniversary of its Columbia Research Enhanced Core ETF (RECS) and Columbia Research Enhanced Value ETF (REVS). These strategic beta ETFs, launched in 2019, leverage quantitative investment research and active insights, offering a cost-effective and tax-efficient vehicle for passive benchmark investors. Both funds have shown strong performance, with RECS achieving a 5-star Overall Morningstar Rating and REVS a 3-star rating, affirming their objective of enhancing market exposure within passive investments.

articles.title: ASML, Lam Research rush to pull US engineers out of China amid new regulations
articles.summary: ASML Holdings and Lam Research are quickly withdrawing American engineers from their operations in China to comply with new US trade restrictions targeting China's semiconductor industry. ASML, a monopolist in EUV lithography systems, has restricted US employees from serving Chinese clients, while Lam Research and KLA Corp have pulled US engineers from supporting equipment in China. These new regulations are expected to severely disrupt China's chip industry due to the crucial role US personnel play within it.

articles.title: The Chips That Make Taiwan the Center of the World
articles.summary: This article examines Taiwan's critical role in the global semiconductor industry, particularly through TSMC, and the geopolitical risks associated with its dependence on the island amid rising U.S.-China tensions. It explores the potential catastrophic economic consequences for the world if military action or political pressure disrupts Taiwan's chip manufacturing capabilities. The author argues that while Taiwan's chip industry provides a "silicon shield," it also makes the island a crucial target in any conflict.

articles.title: Ethereum Merge Not Yet Boosting Crypto Stocks
articles.summary: The Ethereum merge has not yet boosted crypto-correlated stocks, despite being a highly anticipated event. This is largely because most publicly traded crypto miners focus on Bitcoin rather than Ether. However, there's ongoing hope that the merge will have positive long-term effects on crypto equities and ETFs like SATO and BLKC, partly by benefiting companies involved in staking, such as Coinbase, and GPU manufacturers like Nvidia and AMD.

articles.title: Nvidia says it is ceasing all activities in Russia, relocating employees
articles.summary: U.S. chipmaker Nvidia Corp (NVDA.O) announced it is ceasing all activities in Russia and offering employees there the option to continue their jobs in other countries. The decision comes after previously suspending shipments to Russia, stating that recent developments make it no longer possible to operate effectively in the country.

articles.title: 3DMark Speed Way Benchmark Now Available, Test Your PCs Prowess In DX12 Ultimate & Ray Tracing
articles.summary: UL Solutions has released the 3DMark Speed Way benchmark, allowing users to test their PC's performance in DirectX 12 Ultimate and Ray Tracing environments. The new benchmark integrates into the 3DMark suite, which now sees a price increase from $29.99 to $34.99, though existing owners can upgrade for $4.99. Users can download Speed Way from the UL Solutions website or Steam.

articles.title: U.S. aims to hobble China's chip industry with sweeping new export rules
articles.summary: The Biden administration has enacted broad new export controls to impede China's chip industry, specifically targeting its access to advanced semiconductors made with U.S. equipment. These measures expand prior restrictions and are designed to slow Beijing's technological and military advancements, although their effectiveness relies on international cooperation. The rules are expected to significantly impact China's chip manufacturing capabilities, potentially setting the industry back years.

articles.title: 10 Best Robotics Stocks to Buy Now
articles.summary: This article identifies 10 leading robotics stocks and several robotics-focused ETFs for investors interested in the growing automation industry. It details key companies like Intuitive Surgical, Nvidia, and Rockwell Automation, highlighting their contributions to medical, AI, industrial, and defense robotics. The article also provides guidance on where to invest in these stocks and explains why robotic technology is a worthwhile investment.

articles.title: U.S. aims to hobble China’s chip industry with sweeping new export rules
articles.summary: The Biden administration has enacted sweeping new export controls designed to significantly impede China's semiconductor industry. These rules aim to cut China off from certain chips made with U.S. tools globally and restrict the sale of advanced chip-making equipment, potentially setting China's chip manufacturing back by years. The U.S. acknowledges that the effectiveness of these unilateral controls depends on allied nations adopting similar measures.

articles.title: Implementing Path Tracing in ‘Justice’: An Interview with Dinggen Zhan of NetEase
articles.summary: Dinggen Zhan of NetEase discusses the integration of NVIDIA's RTX Path Tracing into the game "Justice Online," highlighting the benefits of physically accurate lighting and unified light transport computation. The interview covers the use of NVIDIA technologies like DLSS 3, NRD, Reflex, and Restir GI, the challenges faced during the five-to-six-month integration process, and the significant visual improvements and cinematic realism achieved. The team plans to continue investing in path tracing for future NetEase games due to its superior visual quality.

articles.title: Ethereum Merge Not Yet Boosting Crypto Stocks
articles.summary: The Ethereum merge has not yet boosted crypto-correlated stocks, including holdings in ETFs like SATO and BLKC, partly because most public crypto miners focus on Bitcoin. However, the switch to staking could benefit companies like Coinbase through increased revenue from staking services, potentially offering longer-term upsides for crypto equities and related ETFs. The article notes that ETH mining equipment is cheaper and more flexible than BTC mining equipment, using GPUs, which could benefit companies like Nvidia and AMD.

articles.title: Meta launches AI software tools to ease switching between Nvidia, AMD chips
articles.summary: Meta Platforms Inc. has launched new open-source AI software tools to enable easier switching between different underlying chips from Nvidia and AMD. These tools, based on PyTorch, can significantly speed up code execution on both Nvidia A100 and AMD MI250 chips, offering developers greater flexibility and reducing migration costs between hardware vendors. This initiative aims to address the vendor lock-in common with Nvidia's CUDA platform and improve hardware choice for deep learning developers.
